intro: Impatiens erecticornis, commonly known as the horned impatiens, is a species native to Southeast Asia. It is a flowering plant in the family Balsaminaceae, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright herb with smooth, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers come in a range of colors, including red, pink, and white, and are often used in ornamental gardening. Impatiens erecticornis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is relatively easy to cultivate.
